commented_code: [Ed25519 Verification checks with small-order key of order - Test 2]

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -52,33 +25,6 @@
   [Ed25519 Verification checks with small-order key of order - Test 2]
discussion_comments.comment_body: any idea why Test 0, Test 1, Test 2 still failing?

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -52,33 +25,6 @@
   [Ed25519 Verification checks with small-order key of order - Test 2]
discussion_comments.comment_body:
Test 0 and 1 have small-order key. Test 0 and 2 have small-order point R in the signature. They should trigger Step 2 and Step 3 of the "verify" operation to return `false`. Since Step 2 and 3 are not implemented in this PR, these three tests are expected to fail.

> 2. If the key data of key represents an invalid point or a small-order element on the Elliptic Curve of Ed25519, return false.
>
> 3. If the point R, encoded in the first half of signature, represents an invalid point or a small-order element on the Elliptic Curve of Ed25519, return false.

This test would have needed `allow-scripts` to run. However, I then realized that the form doesn't run when `allow-scripts` is set: https://github.com/servo/rust-content-security-policy/pull/16/files#diff-b93597bfc0a91f61fffed5b776df0e5021061d0c47bbb61d7eb0e043962fa523L50 Since we weren't checking for `allow-scripts`, this wasn't caught before.
👍 I realised this when coincidentally I tried to update this check earlier. I agree it should be removed.
